Class ComparePlayers

java.lang.Object
ComparePlayers
Direct Known Subclasses:
BasketballPlayer
public class ComparePlayers extends Object
This is a class that does most of the main operating. I attempted to disperse the amount of classes more evenly, but the structure I used condensed most of the methods to this class. This is the top, grandfather class.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Description
    ComparePlayers()
    This is a constructor that initializes the two Array Lists when a ComaprePlayers object is created.

    • addItemsFromFile

      public void addItemsFromFile(String fileName) throws FileNotFoundException
      This is a method that aids in adding the information from the user given text file to the Array List "list".
      Parameters:
      fileName - variable name for the text file's name
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - method throws exception if no file is given

    • addToArray

      public void addToArray(String file)
      This is a method that takes all the information from the text file and clashes them together to create new Basketball Players
      Parameters:
      file - variable name for the text file's name

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer(String name, float pointsPG, float reboundsPG, float assistsPG, float stealsPG, float blocksPG, float turnoversPG)
      This method is the finally creates the player from the text file information and simultaneously adds it to the Array List "list".
      Parameters:
      name - variable for the name of the player
      pointsPG - variable for a player's points per game
      reboundsPG - variable for a player's rebounds per game
      assistsPG - variable for a player's assists per game
      stealsPG - variable for a player's steals per game
      blocksPG - variable for a player's blocks per game
      turnoversPG - variable for a player's turnovers per game

    • printAllPlayers

      public void printAllPlayers()
      This method prints out all the players in the list in order of the player with the most points scored per game on average.

      public void displayAveragePlayer()
      This method creates an object from the AverageNBAPLayer grand-child class and prints it using its toString method.
